thread.title: Jeep Recalling Cherokee SUVs For Wiper Defect
thread.title_full: Jeep Recalling Cherokee SUVs For Wiper Defect

author: jminnick
title: Jeep Recalling Cherokee SUVs For Wiper Defect
text:
Jeep Recalling Cherokee SUVs For Wiper Defect Tue, 09/01/2015 - 9:38am Get today's manufacturing business technology headlines and news - Sign up now! 
DETROIT (AP) â€” Fiat Chrysler is recalling 206,668 Jeep Cherokee SUVs because the windshield wipers can stop working unexpectedly. 
Cherokees from the 2014 model year are affected. There are 158,671 in the U.S., 18,366 in Canada and 3,582 in Mexico. The rest were sold outside North America. 
Fiat Chrysler says static buildup may occur if the wipers are used when it's dry. Static buildup can affect the module that powers the wipers and potentially disable them. 
The company says it's not aware of any accidents or injuries related to the issue. 
Customers will be notified and dealers will repair the vehicles for free. Topics
